item.title: 818: Stand Clear of the Closing Doors | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description In the last year and a half, New York City has scrambled to try and provide shelter and services to over 150,000 migrants. We take a look at how that’s going. Prologue: In the middle of the night, host Ira Glass meets a woman on a mission at Port Authority bus station. (13 minutes)Act One: Producer Valerie Kipnis follows a group of people who’ve just arrived at their new home, a tent shelter in the middle of nowhere.

item.title: 786: It's a Game Show! | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Something we’ve never done before: true stories told in the form of a game show. Prologue: Jiayang Fan has this theory that because she's spent so much time thinking about her own accent when she speaks English, she believes that when she hears other Chinese-Americans speak, she can tell how old they were when they immigrated to the U.S. (7 minutes)Act One: We test Jiayang Fan’s self-proclaimed special skill by having her listen to three Chinese-Americans speak, and then guss when they came to the U.

item.title: 817: The Cavalry Is Not Coming | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description When you realize that help is not on the way, what do you do next? Prologue: Saddam Sayyaleh’s job right now is trying to get trucks filled with aid into Gaza and he knows it’s nowhere close to what’s actually needed. (10 minutes)Act One: Tim Reeves runs a hospital in rural Pennsylvania, and he’s trying to do something that is so hard to do and that he knows is completely up to him.

item.title: 816: Poultry Slam | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description During the highest turkey consumption period of the year, we bring you a This American Life tradition: stories of turkeys, chickens, geese, ducks, fowl of all kinds—real and imagined—and their mysterious hold over us. Prologue: Ira Glass talks with Scharlette Holdman, who works with defense teams on high profile death row cases, and who has not talked to a reporter in more than 25 years. Why did she suddenly end the moratorium on press?

item.title: 815: How I Learned to Shave | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Things our dads taught us, whether they intended to or not. Prologue: Ira talks about the time his dad taught him to shave, and how unusual that was. (5 minutes)Act One: When Jackie read the obits for the man who had invented the famous Trapper Keeper notebook, she was very surprised. As far as she knew, the inventor was very much alive. It was her dad. Not the guy in the obit.

item.title: 814: 814: Parents Are People | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description What happens when you realize the people in charge don’t have the answers. Prologue: Guest Host Chana Joffe-Walt asks her kids when they first encountered adult fallibility. (8 minutes)Act One: A middle schooler really wants to trust the adults have her best interests in mind. But some of the most powerful people at her school begin to make that very difficult. (27 minutes)Postscript: In Israel and Gaza, children are directly facing the fact that the adults around them cannot protect them.

item.title: 813: Is That What I Look Like? | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description You've been seeing yourself, getting to know what you look like, your whole life. So why does it often take an outsider to see things about you that are obvious, and set you straight? Prologue: Guest host Nancy Updike talks about learning something new, and unpleasant, about herself in, where else, a makeup store. She also talks with other people about moments where someone made an observation about them that was shocking.

item.title: 813: Is That What I Look Like? | This American Life

item.title: 319: And the Call Was Coming from the Basement | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description For the lead up to Halloween, scary stories that are all true. Zombie raccoons, haunted houses—real haunted houses!—and things that go "EEEEK!!!" in the night. Plus, a story by David Sedaris in which he walks among the dead. Ira and Albert Donnay read a true ghost story that appeared in a medical journal in 1921. A "Mrs. H" and her family moved into an old rambling house and strange apparitions started appearing, until her brother-in-law figured out the real cause of the ghostly presences.

item.title: 812: The Bear at the End of the Tunnel | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description People who have a good, long time to think about what they’re doing, look hard at what’s ahead of them, and decide to keep moving forward anyway. Prologue: Brothers Wes and Jeff spent a winter tagging black bears in Bryce Canyon National Park. One of the bears they needed to tag decided to hibernate at the end of an usually long tunnel. Wes and Jeff try to figure out their next move.

item.title: 812: The Bear at the End of the Tunnel | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description People who have a good, long time to think about what they’re doing, look hard at what’s ahead of them, and decide to keep moving forward anyway. Transcript

item.title: 477: Getting Away With It | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description People breaking the rules fully, completely, and with no bad consequences. Some justify this by saying they’re doing it for others, or for a greater good. Some really don’t care. And, unlike the mealy weaklings you usually hear on this program: none of these wrongdoers seems regretful about what they’ve done. Ira takes a flight with travel writer Ken Hegan, to witness Ken deploying a travel gadget that keeps the seat in front of him from reclining.

item.title: 811: The One Place I Can’t Go | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Spots we’re avoiding in our private maps of the world. Prologue: Guest host Bim Adewunmi talks to her cousin Kamyl about a funny thing Kamyl did when she was small, regarding a dog named Foxy. (4 minutes)Act One: Comedian Atsuko Okatsuka moved suddenly from Japan to the U.S. when she was eight years old, and has long joked that it was because her grandmother kidnapped her from her dad.

item.title: 811: The One Place I Can’t Go | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Spots we’re avoiding in our private maps of the world. Transcript

item.title: 810: Say It to My Face | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Friends and ex-friends finally talk about the one thing between them they've been avoiding. Prologue: Host Ira Glass tells a story he’s never told anyone before, about something someone said to him. (4 minutes)Act One: Gabe Mollica had something important he needed to discuss with his friend — stewed about it for eight years. But rather than go to that friend, he talked about it with everyone other than that one person.

item.title: 810: Say It to My Face | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Friends and ex-friends finally talk about the one thing between them they’ve been avoiding. Transcript

item.title: 809: The Call | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description One call to a very unusual hotline, and everything that followed. Prologue: Ira talks about a priest who set up what may have been the first hotline in the United States. It was just him, answering a phone, trying to help strangers who called. (2 minutes)Act One: The Never Use Alone hotline was set up so that drug users can call if they are say, using heroin by themselves.

item.title: 809: The Call | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description One call to a very unusual hotline, and everything that followed. Transcript

item.title: 808: The Rest of the Story | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Legendary radio broadcaster Paul Harvey had a popular show called “The Rest of the Story.” Today on our show, we do just that. We hear from people who, whether they want to or not, find themselves face-to-face with the rest of their stories. Prologue: Legendary broadcaster Paul Harvey had one of the most popular radio shows of all time. For 35 years he served up big twists and jaw dropping reveals all with his one-of-a-kind delivery.

item.title: 808: The Rest of the Story | This American Life

item.title: 807: Eight Fights | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Nadia's family is split between Russia and Ukraine, which is pretty common. And when Russia invaded Ukraine, it didn’t just start fighting on the battlefield. It sparked family conflict, too. An intimate story of the war from writer Masha Gessen. Prologue: An extended family, and eight fights. (1 minutes)Fight #1: Luka’s parents – Nadia and Karen – try to figure out where to take him once war breaks out.

item.title: 807: Eight Fights | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Nadia’s family is split between Russia and Ukraine, which is pretty common. And when Russia invaded Ukraine, it didn’t just start fighting on the battlefield. It sparked family conflict, too. An intimate story of the war from writer Masha Gessen. Transcript

item.title: 806: I Can't Quit You, Baby | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description People on the verge of a big change, not wanting to let go. And the people who give them the final push. Prologue: Guest Host Sean Cole gets some scary news about his health, and decides to quit smoking. (5 minutes)Act One: Sean Cole attempts to kick his 35 year-long smoking habit, using a book that’s said to have helped millions of people to quit. (33 minutes)Act Two: Someone writes into the advice column Dear Sugar to ask whether or not they should quit a relationship, and gets a strange but very persuasive response.

item.title: 806: I Can't Quit You, Baby | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description People on the verge of a big change, not wanting to let go. And the people who give them the final push. Transcript

item.title: 805: The Florida Experiment | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Governor Ron DeSantis is running for president on the argument that he’ll do for America what he’s done for Florida. So what’s it like in Florida? Transcript

item.title: 804: The Retrievals | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description At a Yale fertility clinic, dozens of women began their I.V.F. cycles full of expectation and hope. Then a surgical procedure caused them excruciating pain. In the hours that followed, some of the women called the clinic to report their pain — but most of the staff members who fielded the patients’ reports did not know the real reason for the pain, which was that a nurse at the clinic was stealing fentanyl and replacing it with saline.

item.title: 803: Greetings, People Of Earth | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Humans encounter non-human intelligences of various kinds and try to make sense of them. Transcript

item.title: 802: Father's Day | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Ira’s own father, Barry Glass, co-hosts this special Father’s Day show. Transcript

item.title: 801: Must Be Rats on the Brain | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description The one animal we can’t seem to live without, even when we really, really want to. Transcript

item.title: 800: Jane Doe | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Five years after the #MeToo explosion, what’s happened in the lives of the women who stepped forward and went public with their stories? We tell the story of a teenager who spoke out against one of the most powerful people in her state, and what happened next. Transcript

item.title: 799: The Lives of Others | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Looping thoughts about people you barely know, or don’t know at all. Transcript

item.title: 798: Leaving the Fold | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description A week after Jerry Springer’s death, we go back to a story we first broadcast years ago, about a side of Springer most people don’t know and can’t imagine: his years as an idealistic politician in the mold of Bobby Kennedy. Plus other stories of people who try to leave some moment in their life behind, which can be hard. Transcript

item.title: 797: What I Was Thinking As We Were Sinking | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description It’s funny the things that go through your head during a disaster. Transcript

item.title: 796: What Lies Beneath | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Summoning up stuff that’s usually hidden down deep. Transcript

item.title: 795: Nine Months Later | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description It’s been nine months since Roe v. Wade was overturned. We talk to people who wanted abortions right when the laws were changing in their states. They had to wait for appointments, for money to travel or abortion pills. And during that waiting, a lot of interesting things happened. We see how much life has changed, nine months later. Transcript

item.title: 794: So Close and Yet So Far | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description People ​so close to each other, ​in ​extremely intimate situations​,​ who are also a million miles apart. Transcript

item.title: 793: The Problem with Ghosts | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description The ghosts that visit us, the ghosts that never do, and the ghosts that walk among us. Transcript

item.title: 792: When to Leave | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description People staring down that hardest of questions: Is now the time? To leave? Transcript

item.title: 791: Math or Magic? | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description When it comes to finding love, there seems to be two schools of thought on the best way to go about it. One says, wait for that lightning-strike magic. The other says, make a calculation and choose the best option available. Who has it right? Transcript

item.title: 790: You're It | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Sometimes you raise your hand. Other times you’re just the only one left. Transcript

item.title: 789: The Runaround | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description People being dodged, delayed, and evaded—and what they do to put an end to it. Transcript

item.title: 788: Half-Baked Stories About My Dead Mom | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Writer Etgar Keret tries to come up with the stories that capture his late mother, Orna Keret—but it’s hard, he says, because she’s like Maria in West Side Story and she’s also like Thanos from the Avengers. He ends up with a series of very short stories — most just a few paragraphs long — that give glimpses of different sides of her. Transcript

item.title: 787: Baby's First Christmas | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description People experiencing Christmas in brand new ways, giving the holiday even more meaning. Transcript

item.title: 786: It's a Game Show! | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Something we’ve never done before: true stories told in the form of a game show. Transcript

item.title: 785: Through the Looking Glass | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description People trying to coax each other across the line, from one side to the other. Transcript

item.title: 784: Mapmaker, Mapmaker, Make Me a Map | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Not long ago, Republicans in Ohio passed a constitutional amendment to end gerrymandering in the state. And then a funny thing happened. The same Ohio Republicans drew electoral maps that violated their own constitutional amendment. They’ll be using them in this week’s midterm elections. We try to understand how that could happen. Transcript

item.title: 783: Kids These Days | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description We hear from kids who are dealing with some of the country’s most contentious debates. Debates that are supposedly about them. Transcript

item.title: 782: Family Dig | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Two people go on excavations of their families’ pasts. Including the first episode of the new podcast, “We Were Three,” hosted by our longtime producer, Nancy Updike, and from Serial Productions and The New York Times. Transcript

item.title: 781: Watching the Watchers | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description People taking it upon themselves to keep an eye on those in charge. Transcript

item.title: 780: Setting the Record Straight | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Getting to the facts can be difficult, but it’s always the right thing to do. Except when it isn’t. Transcript

item.title: 779: Ends of the Earth | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description An exploration of the very upper limits of what you do for someone you love. Transcript

item.title: 778: Me Minus Me | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description When a fundamental part of yourself changes dramatically, are you still who you thought you were? Transcript

item.title: 777: Name. Age. Detail. | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Ten people were killed at a grocery store in Buffalo, NY. Their stories, as you’ve never heard them. Transcript

item.title: 776: I Work Better on Deadline | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories of people racing against time to solve a problem. Will they make it? Transcript

item.title: 775: The Possum Experiment | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description An investigation into a very basic question about people: Are most of us bad or good? Transcript

item.title: 774: The Pink House at the Center of the World | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description The Supreme Court case that overturned Roe v. Wade began with a lawsuit filed by a Mississippi abortion clinic. On the day Roe was overturned, we were there. Stories from the center of this moment of history, the day it happened. Transcript

item.title: 773: The Longest Distance Between Two Points | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Getting from A to B via Z. Transcript

item.title: 772: The Kids' Table | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Kids navigating hairy situations all on their own, with no help from grown-ups. Transcript

item.title: 771: The Parents Step In | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Government isn’t doing much to prevent school shootings. So parents are jumping in: parents whose kids have died in mass shootings, in the wake of each shooting. They take practical, effective action — and they get results. Transcript

item.title: 770: My Lying Eyes | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description People staring squarely at the truth, and still finding it hard to believe what they’re seeing. Transcript

item.title: 769: The Reluctant Explorer | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description A man finds himself thrust into a new world he didn’t necessarily ask to visit. He takes a look around. Transcript

item.title: 768: The Other Front Lines | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Four personal stories from the war in Ukraine. Transcript

item.title: 767: Do Not Go Gentle | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description In this moment when autocrats and almost-autocrats are getting bolder and more powerful, we bring you two stories of resistance, from Hungary and Russia. Transcript

item.title: 766: Well Someone Had to Do SOMETHING! | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description People trying to jump in and solve other people’s problems, putting themselves directly in the gap between the problem and the solution. Transcript

item.title: 765: Off Course | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Three people, and one animal, who know the path their lives will take until, suddenly, they don’t. Transcript

item.title: 764: School's Out Forever | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description The pandemic broke school. Can we ever go back? Transcript

item.title: 763: The Other Mr. President | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories about Vladimir Putin. Did he come to power in 1999 by killing hundreds of innocent Russians? How’s he really seen in his home country? This show is a mix of old and new stories we’ve done about him. Transcript

item.title: 762: Apocalypse Creep | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description A woman wakes up and discovers her backyard has disappeared, and other stories from places slowly coming apart. Transcript

item.title: 761: The Trojan Horse Affair | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description A while back, one of our producers Brian Reed was in England giving a speech about the podcast he’d hosted, S-Town. A journalism student approached him, asking for advice about a story he wanted to look into – something that’d been big news in Britain, something he’d thought about for years. Brian and the student, Hamza Syed, decided to team up to try and solve the mystery at the heart of that story.

item.title: 760: A City Walks Into an Investigation | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Last week’s story continues, about a Michigan couple who walked into a police officer’s house and made a disturbing discovery. This week: the police officer suffers the consequences and so does the couple. Transcript

item.title: 759: A Couple Walks Into a House | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Rob and Reyna Mathis make an unsettling discovery in the home of a local police officer. Soon, their whole city is asking questions about who the officer really is and what he’s been doing. Transcript

item.title: 758: Talking While Black | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Think back to two summers ago, the summer of 2020, when a series of violent, highly-publicized killings of Black Americans sparked outrage and a national movement to eradicate racism and its evils. That movement gave way to a newer, reactionary one, a backlash that is playing out in schools and school board meetings across America. Host Emanuele Berry shares stories about Black people who got tangled up in this current backlash in both extreme and very personal ways.

item.title: 757: The Ghost in the Machine | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description People use machines to find people they lost. Transcript

item.title: 756: But I Did Everything Right | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description People earnestly doing what they’re told, and absolutely not getting what they were promised. Transcript

item.title: 755: The Convert | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description In 2006, a new convert showed up at a mosque in Orange County, California. Known as Farouk al-Aziz, the convert was actually an FBI informant named Craig Monteilh. That informant’s infiltration of the mosque is at the heart of FBI v Fazaga, a case heard at the Supreme Court last month. We return to our episode from 2012, which tells the story behind it. Transcript

item.title: 754: Spark Bird | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories about birds and the hearts they sway, the havoc they wreak, the lives they change. Transcript

item.title: 753: What We’ve Got Here is Failure to Communicate | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Getting the point across — or trying to, anyway. Transcript

item.title: 752: An Invitation to Tea | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description A man who was imprisoned for 14 years in Guantanamo Bay, without charges, gets out and issues an invitation to all the people who kept him there. Amazingly, three of them agree to talk. Transcript

item.title: 751: Audience of One | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description We bring the movies to you. Transcript

item.title: 750: The Ferryman | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Getting from Point A to Point B—with expert assistance. Transcript

item.title: 749: My Bad | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description An hour devoted to embarrassing stories. They’re not always just little moments – funny, daily stuff that we laugh about later. Some can change you for the rest of your life. Transcript

item.title: 748: The End of the World as We Know It | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description What happens when one family goes all in on fighting climate change. Transcript

item.title: 747: Suitable for Children | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Who thought that would be good for a kid? Transcript

item.title: 746: This Is Just Some Songs | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description We made you a mixtape. Don’t make a big deal out of it or anything. Transcript

item.title: 745: Getting Out | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description People trying to escape all kinds of seemingly impossible situations. Transcript

item.title: 744: Essential | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description The pandemic forced jobs to change, but then the workers changed, too. Transcript

item.title: 743: Don't You Be My Neighbor | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Bad neighbors. What can you do about them? Transcript

item.title: 742: The Thing I'm Getting Over | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description What’s recovery mean, anyway? Transcript

item.title: 741: The Weight of Words | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Words mean things, but some words are especially meaningful. Transcript

item.title: 740: There. I Fixed It. | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Solving problems using very extreme measures. Transcript

item.title: 739: Sisters | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description The bonds between sisters and how they get broken and fixed—or not. Transcript

item.title: 738: Good Grief! | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description So many of us, we don’t want to think about death. We avoid grieving when we lose someone, distract ourselves, look away. In this episode, at a moment when so many families are mourning, we have stories of people figuring out how they’ll grieve, and doing a pretty good job of it. Transcript

item.title: 737: The Daily | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description An ode to life’s daily practices, and what you learn from doing a thing every single day. Transcript

item.title: 736: The Herd | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description What happens when your own community suddenly turns on you? Transcript

item.title: 735: Bloody Feelings | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories about the power of blood. Transcript

item.title: 734: The Campus Tour Has Been Cancelled | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description How the pandemic has thrown college admissions process into a kind of slow-motion chaos. One of the biggest changes: most colleges have stopped requiring the SAT. For decades, there’s been a debate over whether schools should drop the test. What’s it mean that it finally happened? Transcript

item.title: 733: Warriors in the Garden | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description This week, three men who came together to protest the murder of George Floyd. They were unified, loud, and impressive, but over time these three friends end up in three very different places. Transcript

item.title: 732: Secrets | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Why we tell them, and what happens after we do. Transcript

item.title: 731: What Lies Beneath (2021) | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Summoning up stuff that’s usually hidden down deep. Transcript

item.title: 730: The Empty Chair | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Things we’ve lost in the past year — since the first American coronavirus case — that we haven’t talked about so much. Gossip. The chance to make new friends. And much larger stuff. Transcript

item.title: 729: Making the Cut | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description There’s always someone whose job it is to decide if you measure up. Transcript

item.title: 728: Lights, Camera, Christmas! | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description People going to great lengths to throw a special Christmas for their families. Transcript

item.title: 727: Boulder v. Hill | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description What the day-to-day business of saving the world looks like. We visit with one group of people who are trying to rescue us from something very large, and another group trying to rescue us from something very small. Transcript

item.title: 726: Twenty-Five | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description To commemorate our show’s 25th year, we have a program about people who were born the year our show went on the air. Transcript

item.title: 725: Turkey in a Face Mask | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description For Thanksgiving weekend, stories about food, and people who set out on very particular missions with food. Transcript

item.title: 724: Personal Recount | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories of people changing their minds. Transcript

item.title: 723: Squeaker | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description People grappling with an endless presidential election. Transcript

item.title: 722: The Unreality of Now | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Ahead of the election, we have stories about people trying to live in the unreality that defines this moment. Election officials combat a contagion among their very own workers; people who’ve never owned guns suddenly go buy them; and two women who allege they were sexually assaulted by the president compare notes. Transcript

item.title: 721: The Walls Close In | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description People finding themselves stuck in small spaces—an elevator, an attic, an orchestra pit—trying to make sense of their new surroundings. Transcript

item.title: 720: The Moment After This Moment | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description People who are worried — or not worried enough! — about what’s hurtling unstoppably towards them. Transcript

item.title: 719: Trust Me I’m a Doctor | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description A doctor who breaks the law might go to jail like anybody else. But who decides if that doctor gets to keep their medical license? On today’s show, the not-often-talked-about realm of licensing boards, and the disturbing decisions they sometimes make. Transcript

item.title: 718: Same Bed, Different Dreams (2020) | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories of people who are tied together, but imagine radically different futures. In one case, a movie star and her ex-husband plot against Kim Jong-Il. In another, a woman stalks her doppelgänger. And sometimes, one bed is the basis for an entire relationship, even for a man who almost never sees the person who shares his bed. Transcript

item.title: 717: Audience of One (2020) | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description At a time when going to the movies is mostly out of the question, we bring the movies to you. Transcript

item.title: 716: Trail of Tears | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Sarah Vowell and her twin sister Amy headed out on the road to retrace the Trail of Tears – the route their Cherokee ancestors took when expelled from their own land – and reflected on the question, what are we supposed to do with the mix of good and bad that is this country? Transcript

item.title: 715: Long-Awaited Asteroid Finally Hits Earth | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Teachers, students and parents around the country have been bracing themselves all spring and summer long for the start of this unprecedented school year. This week, it’s here. Transcript

item.title: 714: Day at the Beach | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description It’s the last few weeks of summer, so we’re going to the beach! This week, stories from the surf and sand. Transcript

item.title: 713: Made to Be Broken | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description From the moment we wake up in the morning there are a trillion rules — big and little — governing our lives. But sometimes, we encounter one we just can’t abide by. In a pitched moment of rule-questioning, a show about rules and the people who break them. Transcript

item.title: 712: Nice White Parents | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Years ago, producer Chana Joffe-Walt started reporting on one school in New York. She thought the story was about segregation and inequality in public schools. But the more she looked into it, the more she realized she was witnessing something else. She was seeing the inordinate power of white parents at this school. This is the first episode of Chana’s new mini-series: Nice White Parents. Transcript

item.title: 711: How to Be Alone | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description In space, in the ocean, by ourselves, or with others—we’re all just figuring out how to be apart. Transcript

item.title: 710: Umbrellas Down | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description As China’s new national security law tightens its control over Hong Kong, we return to our episode about last fall’s anti-government protests and check in to see how people are responding. Transcript

item.title: 709: The Reprieve | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Michigan has passed its Covid-19 peak, and the state has started opening up. But it’s still been intensely difficult for the staff in the ICU at Henry Ford Hospital in Detroit. We’ve embedded with them over the past few months, and tracked how this pandemic has changed them and their city. Transcript

item.title: 708: Here, Again | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description An exhaustingly familiar story. Maybe it’ll have a different ending this time, but maybe not. We hear what different people said and did one weekend in reaction to the killing of George Floyd. Transcript

item.title: 707: We Are in the Future | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description In this moment of sorrow, protest, and rage in the wake of George Floyd’s death, we offer this as a break from the dreadful present: our show about Afrofuturism. It’s a way of looking at Black culture that’s fantastic and hopeful, which feels especially urgent during a time without a lot of optimism. Featuring the song “The Deep” by clppng. Transcript

item.title: 706: A Mess to Be Reckoned With | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Lissa Yellow Bird searches for missing people. Cold cases, mostly. People no one else is looking for. It’s not her job, but a lot of Native Americans go missing and their cases remain unsolved, so families often ask Lissa for help. But then, Lissa’s own niece goes missing. Transcript

item.title: 705: Time Out | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description While sports of all kinds have been put on pause, we bring you favorite stories from back when people were still on football fields, boxing rings, and basketball courts. Transcript

item.title: 704: Our Pulitzer-Winning Episode | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Last week, our episode “The Out Crowd” won the very first Pulitzer Prize ever awarded to a radio show. This is the episode that won, with some updates on the stories. Hear what the Trump administration’s “Remain in Mexico” policy actually means, on the ground, at the Mexican border. Transcript

item.title: 703: Stuck! | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description During a time when a lot of us feel like we are living in a holding pattern, stories of people feeling stuck. Transcript

item.title: 702: One Last Thing Before I Go | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Words can seem so puny and ineffective sometimes. On this show, we have stories in which ordinary people make last ditch efforts to get through to their loved ones, using a combination of small talk and not-so-small talk. Transcript

item.title: 701: Black Box | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Desperate to know what happened to his family, a man obsessively decodes the only information about them he can get. That, and other stories of people looking into the void for answers. Transcript

item.title: 700: Embiggening | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Sometimes a sketch of a thing needs filling in for its true significance to be known. Transcript

item.title: 699: Fiasco! | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories of when things go wrong. Really wrong. When you leave the normal realm of human error, fumble, mishap, and mistake and enter the territory of really huge breakdowns. Fiascos. Things go so awry that normal social order collapses. Transcript

item.title: 698: The Test | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description The coronavirus has now fully arrived in the United States. This week, stories of people trying to rise to that challenge, in some pretty extreme situations. Transcript

item.title: 697: Alone Together | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description This week, as the staff creates the episode from their apartments and houses, with our host in quarantine, in this moment when everyone’s reaching out to the people they love, we put together a collection of family stories, with some timely stuff at the top. Transcript

item.title: 696: Low Hum of Menace | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Things do not seem fine at all, but it’s hard to say why. Transcript

item.title: 695: Everyone's a Critic | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description People squirming in a world where everything is rated and reviewed. Transcript

item.title: 694: Get Back to Where You Once Belonged | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description People looking everywhere to find a place—any place—where, for once, they don’t have to be the odd man out. Transcript

item.title: 693: Abdi the American | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description We return to our story about Abdi Nor from 2015, with some big news about his life today. When we first broadcast the story, Abdi was a Somali refugee living in Kenya desperately trying – against long odds – to get to the United States. Then he got the luckiest break of his life: he won a lottery that puts him on a short list for a U.S. visa.

item.title: 692: The Show of Delights | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description In these dark, combative times, we attempt the most radical counterprogramming we could imagine: a show made up entirely of stories about delight. Transcript

item.title: 691: Gardens of Branching Paths | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Other universes that are just like our own, but with one small difference. Transcript

item.title: 690: Too Close to Home | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description For the holidays, stories of families finally addressing the thorny thing they’ve never really talked about. Transcript

item.title: 689: Digging Up the Bones | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description There’s a lot that can be gained from unearthing the past – learning about oneself, learning about others. But, it doesn’t always go how you’d expect. Transcript

item.title: 688: The Out Crowd | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Reports from the frontlines of the Trump administration’s “Remain in Mexico” asylum policy. We hear from asylum seekers waiting across the border in Mexico, in a makeshift refugee camp, and from the officers who sent them there to wait in the first place. This episode won the 2020 Pulitzer Prize for audio reporting, the first ever given for audio journalism. Transcript

item.title: 687: Small Things Considered | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories about being little. Secret writings in tiny letters. The power of a very small number. And a medication that’s supposed to cure shortness. Transcript

item.title: 686: Umbrellas Up | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description For over 100 days now, protestors in Hong Kong have taken to the streets every weekend. What it’s like to live through that. Transcript

item.title: 685: We Come From Small Places | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description The staff goes to one of the biggest parties in New York City, the Labor Day Carnival and the West Indian American Day Parade in Brooklyn. Transcript

item.title: 684: Burn It Down | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories of people who decide the only way forward — for real change — is to burn everything to the ground. Transcript

item.title: 683: Beer Summit | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Two people, sitting down over a beer, hashing out their differences and understanding where the other guy is coming from. Hard to imagine these days, right? It’s so rare right now that someone is curious enough to actually see the other person’s point of view. This week on the show, beer summits. Including going behind the scenes of the most famous one ever. Transcript

item.title: 682: Ten Sessions | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description What if someone told you about a type of therapy that could help you work through unhealed trauma in just ten sessions? Some people knock through it in two weeks. Jaime Lowe tried the therapy—and recorded it. Transcript

item.title: 681: Escape From the Lab | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description What happens when our most ingenious creations actually make it out into the world. Transcript

item.title: 680: The Weight Of Words (2019) | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Words mean things, but some words are especially meaningful — whether in a survival manual, a song lyric, or a slur. Transcript

item.title: 679: Save the Girl | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description People go on missions to save young girls from danger. But sometimes they get so caught up in the mission that it overshadows the girl herself. Transcript

item.title: 678: The Wannabes | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description This country is crawling in presidential candidates right now and they’re bumping into each other in Des Moines and yelling over each other in Miami. We hang out with them, in this weird early period of the election when they’re easy to walk right up to. Transcript

item.title: 677: Seeing Yourself In the Wild | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories of those unexpected moments when we see who we really are. Transcript

item.title: 676: Here’s Looking at You, Kid | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Adults telling kids who they are, and kids wondering — are they right? Transcript

item.title: 675: I’m on TV?? | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description What it’s like to be momentarily big on the small screen. Transcript

item.title: 674: Get a Spine! | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories of people standing up for themselves, shaking off their fear, bracing themselves, and doing what they’ve been scared to do. Transcript

item.title: 673: Left Behind | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description People figuring out how to move through a world in which something important has disappeared. Transcript

item.title: 672: No Fair! | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories of very small injustices and also one very big one. Transcript

item.title: 671: Anything Can Be Anything | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description People connecting the dots that maybe should not be connected. Transcript

item.title: 670: Beware the Jabberwock | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories from the upside-down world where conspiracy theorists dwell. Transcript

item.title: 669: Scrambling to Get Off the Ice | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description The Democrats on the House Judiciary Committee may have to fight to protect Mueller’s investigation and make his report public. Now that they’re in the majority, they have new tools they can use. Our producer Zoe Chace spent weeks behind the scenes with them as they tried out their new powers for the first time. This and other stories of people scrambling to get their footing on some challenging terrain.

item.title: 668: The Long Fuse | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description People tossing words out into the world impulsively, to ignite and burn over decades. Transcript

item.title: 667: Wartime Radio | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Intimate and personal dispatches from two very different battlefields: A small town in the Syrian war. And the U.S. opioid epidemic. Each came from a DIY radio outfit. (Okay, one’s a podcast.) Transcript

item.title: 666: The Theme That Shall Not Be Named | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Satan! In his many surprising manifestations, all around us. Transcript

item.title: 665: Before Things Went to Hell | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description We revisit those moments of calm before the storm, when things could have gone very differently, but instead, they went to hell. Transcript

item.title: 664: The Room of Requirement | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Libraries aren’t just for books. They’re often spaces that transform into what you need them to be: a classroom, a cyber café, a place to find answers, a quiet spot to be alone. It’s actually kind of magical. This week, we have stories of people who roam the stacks and find unexpected things that just happen to be exactly what they required. Transcript

item.title: 663: How I Read It | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Documents you don’t normally think of, showing you things you didn’t expect. Transcript

item.title: 662: Where There Is a Will | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories of people who believe there is always a way. And also those who don’t. Transcript

item.title: 661: But That's What Happened | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories of women in unsettling situations. When they try to explain what’s wrong, they’re told that they don’t understand—that there’s nothing unsettling about it. Transcript

item.title: 660: Hoaxing Yourself | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description People who tell a lie and then believe the lie more than anyone else. Transcript

item.title: 659: Before the Next One | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description There’s no rulebook on how to handle a school shooting. And no real way to prepare for one. This week, people take what they’ve learned from these tragedies and try to use that knowledge to save others. Transcript

item.title: 658: The Unhappy Deciders | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Making big decisions about other people’s lives can feel pretty awful. Zoe Chace followed Senator Jeff Flake as he decided to force the Senate to delay its vote on Judge Kavanaugh. Among her discoveries: Those protestors in the elevator? They aren’t the reason he did what he did. Transcript

item.title: 657: The Runaways | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description A bunch of teenagers go missing from a town in Long Island. For months, the police treat them as runaways, ignoring the kids’ parents, who keep trying to tell them otherwise. They keep trying to tell them that something much worse might have happened. Transcript

item.title: 656: Let Me Count the Ways | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Yes, youve heard about the family separations. Youve heard about the travel ban. But there are dozens of ways the Trump administration is cracking down on immigration across many agencies, sometimes in ways so small and technical it doesnt make headlines. This week, the quiet bureaucratic war that’s even targeting legal immigrants. Transcript

item.title: 655: The Not-So-Great Unknown | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description What happens when unadventurous people end up in adventurous situations. Like an astronaut who goes to places no one has gone before, even though he’s not really into outer space. Transcript

item.title: 654: The Feather Heist | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description A flute player breaks into a British museum and makes off with a million dollars worth of dead birds. Transcript

item.title: 653: Crime Scene (2018) | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Every crime scene hides a story. In this week’s show, we hear about crime scenes and the stories they tell. Transcript

item.title: 652: ICE Capades | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Dispatches from a government agency in its tumultuous teenage years. Transcript

item.title: 651: If You Build It, Will They Come? | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description A young preacher opens a new church. A new restaurant reopens old wounds. This week, stories of people trying to build something that will last. Transcript

item.title: 650: Change You Can Maybe Believe In | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description An innocent man forgives the cop who framed him. An Argentinian talk show that usually treats women as objects suddenly gets really interested in feminism. This week, stories about changes that seem too tidy to be true. Transcript

item.title: 649: It's My Party and I'll Try If I Want To | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Democrats are desperate to retake part of Congress. Their best shot is the House. This fall, they’ll be slugging it out with Republicans—but in the meantime, they’re slugging it out with each other. The progressive and moderate wings of the Democratic party are going head-to-head in Democratic primaries all over the country right now, wrestling over what the party should be and stand for. This week, we have the story of a candidate in one primary like that.

item.title: 648: Unteachable Moment | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories about people trying to learn something when no one is clear what the lesson is supposed to be. Transcript

item.title: 647: LaDonna | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description A security guard at the airport notices something going wrong on the tarmac, and takes it upon herself to fix it. It’s way harder than she expects. Transcript

item.title: 646: The Secret of My Death | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Cryptic messages on a cell phone and a teeter totter at a construction site: these are clues people found, trying to make sense of a death. Transcript

item.title: 645: My Effing First Amendment | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Conservative students don’t feel like their ideas are welcome on campus. So they’re fighting back. We go to Nebraska, where one skirmish spins out of control. Transcript

item.title: 644: Random Acts of History | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories about people who accidentally bump into unsettling facts of history in settings meant to teach them history. What they end up learning is very different from what they’re supposed to. Transcript

item.title: 643: Damned If You Do… | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description It’s one thing to weigh pros and cons. But sometimes all you have is con and con. This week, stories of people having to make a choice, when no good options exist. Transcript

item.title: 642: The Impossible Dream | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Before he leaves the Senate for good, Republican Jeff Flake is trying to get a bill passed. He has his work cut out for him, with a Senate that barely brings anything to the floor, a party he feels estranged from, and a president who seems to hate his guts. Producer Zoe Chace hung out with him for four months. Transcript

item.title: 641: The Walls | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories from border walls around the world, where one place ends and another begins. And the strange ecosystems that arise. Transcript

item.title: 640: Five Women | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description As Harvey Weinstein goes to trial, we have a different kind of #MeToo story about several women who worked for the same man. They tell us not only about their troubling encounters with him, but also about their lives beforehand. Who were they when they entered the workplace, and how did their personal histories shape the way they dealt with his harassment? Transcript

item.title: 639: In Dog We Trust | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Exactly how much are the animals that live in our homes caught up in our everyday family dynamics? Transcript

item.title: 638: Rom-Com | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description The one thing you know for sure when you’re watching a romantic comedy is that it’s going to turn out okay in the end. When you’re living one? Not so much. This week, stories that unfold like rom-coms. Transcript

item.title: 637: Words You Can't Say | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description In this politically charged climate, it feels like you have to be super careful with your language, no matter who you are or what side you’re on. Stories about people who say the “wrong” thing and suffer the consequences, including a very conservative Republican from Louisiana who’s lambasted for being too liberal. Transcript

item.title: 636: I Thought It Would Be Easier | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description A year into Trump’s presidency, stories of politicians—of both parties—unable to accomplish tasks that seem pretty straightforward. Transcript

item.title: 635: Chip in My Brain | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description A boy who can’t dribble gets a coach, a new best friend, and something to believe in. Transcript

item.title: 634: Human Error in Volatile Situations | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Even the best laid plans can go catastrophically wrong when humans get involved. This week, people bungle simple operations on some of the most dangerous weapons in the world. Transcript

item.title: 633: Our Town - Part Two | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description So many people in Albertville, AL wondered what it cost them in taxes when thousands of undocumented immigrants moved to their town. One woman drove our host Ira Glass to the grocery store to watch a random Latina mom buy some milk with government assistance, to try to prove her point. So what’d all the newcomers really cost? And what was their effect on crime, schools, and politics? This two-part series won a 2019 duPont-Columbia Award.

item.title: 632: Our Town - Part One | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description We spent eight months and did over a hundred interviews to try to bypass the usual rhetoric and get to the bottom of what really happened when undocumented workers showed up in one Alabama town. Transcript

item.title: 631: So a Monkey and a Horse Walk Into a Bar | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description This week, blurring the line between animal and human. Transcript

item.title: 630: Things I Mean to Know | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description There are so many facts about the world that we take for granted—without ever questioning how we know them. Of course the earth revolves around the sun. Of course my dog loves me. But how exactly do we know things like that are true? This week, stories of people trying to unspool some of life’s certainties, and what they find. Transcript

item.title: 629: Expect Delays | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description We all love to travel to different places, but not many of us like the stressful, banal process of the journey. This week, stories about delays—including a town known entirely for its speed trap, and a woman who comes up against bureaucratic nightmares every time she wants to go just a few blocks away. Transcript

item.title: 628: In the Shadow of the City | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories that take place on the edge of civilization, just out of sight. Transcript

item.title: 627: Suitable for Children (2017) | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Who thought that would be good for a kid? Transcript

item.title: 626: White Haze | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Right-wing groups like the Proud Boys say they have no tolerance for racism or white supremacist groups. Their leader Gavin McInnes disavowed the white nationalist rally in Charlottesville. But the Proud Boys believe “the West is the best,” which, one of them points out, is not such a big jump from “whites are best.” And one of the Proud Boys organized the Charlottesville rally. (The group now claims he was a spy.

item.title: 625: Essay B | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description In 1967, the first two Black students were enrolled at an all-white private boarding school in Virginia. The main reason they were there? To benefit the white kids. Transcript

item.title: 624: Private Geography | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Everyone walks around on their own private map of the world. The places we’re from and how they made us, whether we like it or not. Transcript

item.title: 623: We Are in the Future (2017) | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description One of our producers, Neil Drumming, has recently become fascinated with Afrofuturism. It’s more than sci-fi. It’s a way of looking at black culture that’s fantastic, creative, and oddly hopeful—which feels especially urgent during a time without a lot of optimism. Transcript

item.title: 622: Who You Gonna Call? | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description When everything goes wrong, one of the first things we think is, “Who do I call?” This week, stories of lucky people who have found the exact right person to ring up for help. Transcript

item.title: 621: Fear and Loathing in Homer and Rockville | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Two towns where people got really upset about undocumented immigrants, even though in both places, that did not seem to be the most important thing happening at all. One of the towns, a small town in Alaska, has no undocumented immigrants at all, but the possibility of them arriving put the whole town at each other’s throats. Transcript

item.title: 620: To Be Real | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Most of the time, we show the world a pretty superficial version of ourselves. “How about that weather?” But this week—people who try to go deeper, to get to something real, in some unexpected places: war, magic and porn. Transcript

item.title: 619: The Magic Show | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Just a few years before he got the internship at NPR that started him in radio, our host Ira Glass had another career. He performed magic at children’s birthday parties. A powerful sense of embarrassment has prevented him from ever doing an episode on the subject, but when he learned that producer David Kestenbaum was also a kid conjurer, they decided to dive in together. Transcript

item.title: 618: Mr. Lie Detector | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description A polygraph operator and his strange journey. And other stories. Transcript

item.title: 617: Fermi’s Paradox | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Three people grapple with the question, “Are we alone?” Transcript

item.title: 616: I Am Not a Pirate | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description To be, or not to be a pirate? This week, that is the question. Hold fast, mateys! We have stories about both historical and modern-day swashbucklers who loot, pillage, and question their choices. Transcript

item.title: 615: The Beginning of Now | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Before Donald Trump started his presidential campaign in 2015, there was a congressional race that redefined what was possible in American politics. Steve Bannon and Breitbart News got involved in that race early, just like they later got deeply involved in Donald Trump’s race. On this week’s show: What happened in that campaign, what it made it work, and how we got to now. Transcript

item.title: 614: The Other Mr. President (2017) | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description What it’s actually like to live in the confusing information landscape that is Putin’s Russia. Transcript

item.title: 613: OK, I’ll Do It | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories of people who decide that they are the best person for the job, no matter how dangerous. Including a story about a stay-at-home mom with a history of gun running for a guerilla organization, and a surgeon who does surgery…on himself. Transcript

item.title: 612: Ask a Grown-Up | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories from people who need a grown-up. Featuring teenage girls asking for advice about their love lives and Ira’s tribute to his very grown-up friend Mary. Transcript

item.title: 611: Vague and Confused | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description A show about rules and what happens when they’re vague and randomly enforced. Transcript

item.title: 610: Grand Gesture | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description People going to very extreme measures to demonstrate their feelings. Transcript

item.title: 609: It’s Working Out Very Nicely | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description This week we document what happened when the President’s executive order went into effect temporarily banning travel from seven countries, and we talk about the way it was implemented. A major policy change thrown into the world like a fastball with no warning. It’s hard not to ask: “What just happened? What was that all about?” Transcript

item.title: 608: The Revolution Starts At Noon | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Some people are super-stoked for the political changes that are coming. We hear from them. And others. Transcript

item.title: 607: Didn’t We Solve This One? | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description We’ve fought two wars since 9/11. We got help from tens of thousands of Iraqis and Afghans—some were targeted or killed because they helped us. We owe these people. We’ve passed laws that say so. So why has it been so hard for us to get many of them to safety? Transcript

item.title: 606: Just What I Wanted | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories from people who want something desperately—for Christmas or otherwise—and then have their wishes fulfilled. Or do they? Transcript

item.title: 605: Kid Logic | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Kids using perfectly logical arguments, and arriving at perfectly wrong conclusions. Transcript

item.title: 604: 20 Years Later | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Samantha Broun talks to cops, politicians, inmates, and family closest to the crime that changed policy 20 years ago for inmates serving life sentences in Pennsylvania. It’s a crime Samantha knows well, because it happened to her mom. Transcript

item.title: 603: Once More, With Feeling | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories of people who decide to rethink the way they’ve been doing things, or try to get others to do that. Including a woman who decides to confront the men who catcall her, and get them to give it up forever. Transcript

item.title: 602: The Sun Comes Up | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description People around the country talking about the coming four years. Some of them exultant, some of them, as President Obama said Wednesday, “less so.” Transcript

item.title: 601: Master of Her Domain… Name | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description A story about Hillary Clinton that offers a different picture than what we’ve been hearing from both sides during this campaign. And some funny stuff, because everyone’s tired of the election. Transcript

item.title: 600: Will I Know Anyone at This Party? | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Right now lots of Republicans feel like they don’t recognize their own party. Like a Minnesota congressman who’s confused when the residents in his district, people he’s known for years, start calling for a ban on Muslims moving to their town. This episode won a 2018 duPont-Columbia Award. Transcript

item.title: 599: Seriously? | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Watching lies become the truth in this year’s election. And a few people who try to bridge the gap between the way the two sides see the facts. Transcript

item.title: 598: My Undesirable Talent | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description San Francisco’s Spider-Man burglar was remarkable. He dropped into buildings from skylights, leapt 10 feet from one roof to another. But mostly, his talent got him into trouble. This week, his story, and stories of other undesirable talents. Transcript

item.title: 597: One Last Thing Before I Go (2016) | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Words can seem so puny and ineffective sometimes. On this show, we have stories in which ordinary people make last ditch efforts to get through to their loved ones, using a combination of small talk and not-so-small talk. Transcript

item.title: 596: Becoming a Badger | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description This week, stories about people trying their best to turn themselves into something else—like a badger. Or a professional comedian, in a language they didn’t grow up speaking. Transcript

item.title: 595: Deep End of the Pool | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description What do you do when you’re thrown into a situation you’re not prepared for? And while you’re flailing around—what happens to the people who depend on you? This week we present stories of people who find themselves in over their heads, including an attorney who knows little about criminal law assigned to defend a young man facing twenty years in prison. Transcript

item.title: 594: My Summer Self | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Summer is a time when change seems more possible than ever. But is that really how it happens? Can people actually reinvent themselves in the warmer months? This week we present stories — and some comedy — about people and their summer selves. Transcript

item.title: 593: Don’t Have to Live Like a Refugee | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description We return to Greece with stories of people trying to move on with their lives in whatever way they can. We meet a couple who fell in love even though they weren’t expecting anything like that to happen, and even though her family didn’t approve. We also meet a shopkeeper in a camp who’s running what amounts to a cigarette charity. (Part One) Transcript

item.title: 592: Are We There Yet? | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description A bunch of us from our show went to refugee camps all over Greece. We found people falling in love, kids mad at their parents for dragging them to Europe, women doing their laundry in a baseball stadium locker room, and hundreds of people living at a gas station—sitting next to the pumps, smoking. Also: wild pigs. 57,000 refugees are stuck in Greece, making homes in some surprising locations.

item.title: 591: Get Your Money's Worth | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories of people trying to make sure they get what they paid for, from political change to bedroom slippers. We follow a donor as he vets presidential candidates, and go inside a company wrestling with the consequences of its “no questions asked,” lifetime return policy. Transcript

item.title: 590: Choosing Wrong | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories of people making the wrong choice, even though the right one is staring them squarely in the eye. Basketball players making a conscious decision to not do the thing that makes them better, pollsters refusing to see the truth of Donald Trump, and more. Transcript

item.title: 589: Tell Me I’m Fat | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description The way people talk about being fat is shifting. With one-third of Americans classified as overweight, and another third as obese, and almost none of us losing weight and keeping it off, maybe it’s time to rethink the way we see being fat. A show inspired by Lindy West’s book Shrill. Transcript

item.title: 588: Mind Games | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description People who try simple mind games on others and find themselves in way over their heads. Transcript

item.title: 587: The Perils of Intimacy | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories about mysteries that exist in relationships we thought couldn’t possibly surprise us, the strangeness of putting our wants on the line with someone who may not share them at all, and how much we’re willing to risk for someone we may never see again. Transcript

item.title: 586: Who Do We Think We Are? | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description It’s nice to belong, to feel connected to others. But what happens when you realize that your fundamental beliefs don’t line up with the people you want to be close to? Do you bring it up? And, what does that conversation sound like? Including a story by Mariya Karimjee, pictured. Guest host Sean Cole sits in for Ira. Transcript

item.title: 585: In Defense of Ignorance | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Exactly how incompetent you are. What your ex’s best friend really thinks of you. The approximate time that you will die. Some things in life are better not to know about. And sometimes there can be a benefit to not knowing. In this episode — examples of ignorance truly being bliss, or even being an asset. Transcript

item.title: 584: For Your Reconsideration | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description The older and wiser we get, the more bewildering our past decisions can seem. This week, people revisit those decisions — and we revisit a story we aired a year ago with new, fascinating updates about a groundbreaking study that turned out to be false. Transcript

item.title: 583: It’ll Make Sense When You’re Older | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Kids do not like being told it’ll make sense when they’re older. They’re pretty sure the grown-ups are wrong. Transcript

item.title: 582: When the Beasts Come Marching In | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description We human beings think we run the world, that we’ve got things under control. Then an animal shows up, and things don’t go as planned. This week, seals, wolves, and a moose drop in and show us who isn’t boss. Transcript

item.title: 581: Anatomy of Doubt | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description This week, a story about doubt: how it germinated, spread, and eventually took hold of an entire community, with terrible consequences. This episode won a 2016 Peabody Award. Transcript

item.title: 580: That's One Way to Do It | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Forget the easy way. This week, stories about people who come up with very innovative…and unusual…solutions to their problems. Including the story of a young voter who defies political categorization. Transcript

item.title: 579: My Damn Mind | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description The brain! It’s powerful! Two stories of the brain working for and against its owners. Transcript

item.title: 578: I Thought I Knew You | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description This week, stories of people who are feeling the ground shift underneath them when people they are close to change. Including conservative radio host Tony Beam in South Carolina who is completely baffled by the candidate his audience has decided to get behind this election season. Transcript

item.title: 577: Something Only I Can See | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description When you’re the only one who can see something, sometimes it feels like you’re in on a special secret. The hard part is getting anyone to believe your secret is real. This week, people trying to show others what they see—including a woman with muscular dystrophy who believes she has the same condition as an Olympic athlete. Transcript

item.title: 576: Say Yes To Christmas | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description No Christmas can ever be as good as the ones you had as a kid. But this week we go all in and bring the joy, the spontaneity, the sense that anything can happen back to Christmas. Transcript

item.title: 575: Poetry of Propaganda | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Sure, there’s a crude message that propaganda is trying to get across. But like poetry, when you know how to read it, propaganda contains lots of more subtle messages that you might not see at first glance. This week: examples, big and small, from around the world. Transcript

item.title: 574: Sinatra’s 100th Birthday | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description For Frank Sinatra’s 100th Birthday: stories, tributes, and attempts to understand the Chairman of the Board. An updated version of an episode originally broadcast back in 1997. Transcript

item.title: 573: Status Update | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Most of the time, the updates we share about our lives are small and inconsequential. This week, status updates that interrupt daily life. We hear two friends talk about how one of them has become rich and famous. And an entire town gets a status update on itself. Transcript

item.title: 572: Transformers | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description People deciding to make very big changes. Transcript

item.title: 571: The Heart Wants What It Wants | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Emily Dickinson said “The heart wants what it wants.” This week stories from people who take that notion to extremes, and are unapologetic about it. Transcript

item.title: 570: The Night in Question | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Twenty years ago, the prime minister of Israel was assassinated. The killer was a lone gunman, Israeli and Jewish, just like the prime minister. Lots of witnesses saw it happen; the assassin confessed immediately, that night, and has never recanted. But today, oddly, lots of people don’t believe it happened that way. And a question hangs over the country: did this act change the fate of the nation?

item.title: 569: Put a Bow on It | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description This week we go into the room at the headquarters of fast food chain Hardee’s with the people who decided that this burger with beef, hot dogs, and chips is what America should be eating. We’ll hear the story of how they sold that burger and other instances where how you tell the story is more important than the literal facts. Transcript

item.title: 568: Human Spectacle 2015 | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Gladiators in the Colosseum. Sideshow performers. Reality television. We’ve always loved to gawk at the misery or majesty of others. But this week, we ask the question: What’s it like when the tables are turned and all eyes are on you? An episode from last year, with one story swapped. Transcript

item.title: 567: What’s Going On In There? | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Often we see someone’s situation from the outside and think we know exactly what’s going on. This week we get inside and find out just how much more interesting the reality of it is. Including a teenaged girl who records a remarkable story about the boyfriend who abuses her, and why it’s so hard to break up with him. Transcript

item.title: 566: The Land of Make Believe | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description A father constructs an elaborate fantasy to occupy his 12 children, and a woman finds herself sucked into a world of make believe that we almost never get to see inside. Transcript

item.title: 565: Lower 9 + 10 | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Katrina bus tours go all over New Orleans, but it’s illegal for them to go into the Lower 9th Ward, the area that’s been the slowest to rebuild. This week we go around talking to residents there about what matters the most to them (and what doesn’t) ten years after the hurricane. The episode we did in 2005 the week of the storm is here. Transcript

item.title: 564: Too Soon? | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description When is too soon for that celebrity comeback; that joke that is either brilliant or full-on repugnant; that parent-child conversation? This week: stories about a fallen man trying to kickstart his career with a reality show, and an awkward moment between a mom and a daughter. Transcript

item.title: 563: The Problem We All Live With - Part Two | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Last week we looked at a school district integrating by accident. This week: a city going all out to integrate its schools. Plus, a girl who comes up with her own one-woman integration plan. Transcript

item.title: 562: The Problem We All Live With - Part One | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Right now, all sorts of people are trying to rethink and reinvent education, to get poor minority kids performing as well as white kids. But there’s one thing nobody tries anymore, despite lots of evidence that it works: desegregation. Nikole Hannah-Jones looks at a district that, not long ago, accidentally launched a desegregation program. Transcript

item.title: 561: NUMMI (2015) | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description A car plant in Fremont California that might have saved the U.S. car industry. In 1984, General Motors and Toyota opened NUMMI as a joint venture. Toyota showed GM the secrets of its production system: How it made cars of much higher quality and much lower cost than GM achieved. Frank Langfitt explains why GM didn’t learn the lessons—until it was too late. Transcript

item.title: 560: Abdi and the Golden Ticket | This American Life
