item.description: Podcast Description How should we react to people who are in non-monogamous relationships? What should we think of these struggles with monogamy? Transcript

item.title: 94: How To | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description What happens during a “how-to,” and what our how-to’s say about us. Most how-to’s promise that you’ll not only learn skills, you’ll be transformed. Transcript

item.title: 93: Valentine’s Day ’98 | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories about couples that all take place decades after that moment their eyes first meet. Transcript

item.title: 92: Leave the Mask On | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories about those moments when someone tries to tell you a little bit more about themselves than you’d really rather know. Transcript

item.title: 91: Escape the Box | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories of people trying to escape the box of their own lives, and create new lives. Transcript

item.title: 90: Telephone | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories of who we are on the phone, of things we learn on the phone, and of things that happen on the phone that don’t happen anywhere else. Transcript

item.title: 89: Sibling Rivalry | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories about people who are destined to fight: brothers and sisters. Transcript

item.title: 88: Numbers | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Numbers lie. Numbers cover over complicated feelings and ambiguous situations. In this week’s show, stories of people trying to use numbers to describe things that should not be quantified. Transcript

item.title: 87: A Very Special Sedaris Christmas | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories from David Sedaris’s book of Christmas stories, Holidays on Ice, read onstage by David, Julia Sweeney and actor Matt Malloy. Transcript

item.title: 86: How to Take Money from Strangers | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Two stories of how to get money from strangers. In both stories, the money is made by people who make the strangers feel good about themselves and about their nation. Transcript

item.title: 85: Poultry Slam 1997 | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Humans have turned chicken and turkey into what we want them to be, which means that chickens and turkeys are a mirror of ourselves. Transcript

item.title: 84: Harold | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description The story of Harold Washington, the greatest politician you’ve probably never heard of, and the white backlash that was set off when he became Chicago’s first black mayor. This weekend is the 30th anniversary of his death. Transcript

item.title: 83: One of Us | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories of outsiders who want to be insiders, and vice versa. Transcript

item.title: 82: Haunted | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories of people who are haunted, not by ghosts or phantoms, but by other people. Transcript

item.title: 81: Guns | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Americans who love their guns, and the Americans who love them. Transcript

item.title: 80: Running After Antelope | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories of people engaged in a battle with nature — a battle they don’t stand much chance of winning. Most of the show is Scott Carrier’s story of trying for twelve years to chase down and catch an antelope by foot. Transcript

item.title: 79: Stuck in the Wrong Decade | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description People stuck in the wrong decade, or simply carrying a lot of the props from another decade. Transcript

item.title: 78: How Bad Is Bad? | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description How bad is bad enough to count? To go to hell? Transcript

item.title: 77: Pray | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Can the secular world and the religious world understand each other? We ask that question while visiting Colorado Springs, Colorado, where Pastor Ted Haggard at the New Life Church has put in place a project to pray in front of the home of every person in the city, systematically, block by block and house by house. He’s also helped organize a 24-hour, 365-day-a-year “prayer shield” over the city; all-night prayer vigils; and more.

item.title: 76: Mob | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description The mob as portrayed in movies, and as it is in real life. And its hold over us. Transcript

item.title: 75: Kindness of Strangers | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories of the kindness of strangers and where it leads. Also, the unkindness of strangers and where that can lead. All of today’s stories take place in the city most people think of as the least kind city in America: New York. Transcript

item.title: 74: Conventions | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description What happens when people with one common interest gather in monstrous, fluorescent-lit halls for the weekend? Sometimes they drive each other crazy, sometimes they fall in love. Transcript

item.title: 73: Blame It on Art | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description The darker side of the art world: petty jealousies, competitiveness, failure. And also what’s so great about art. Transcript

item.title: 72: Trek | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description An idiosyncratic first-person travelogue about race relations and tourism from radio producer Rich Robinson and television producer Josh Seftel. Their radio story is about a trip they took to the new South Africa. Rich Robinson is black. Josh Seftel is white. The interracial pair travel through the still mostly-segregated society and have very different opinions about what they see, especially when it comes to some distant relatives of Josh’s in South Africa.

item.title: 71: Defying Sickness | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories of people trying to do exactly what the doctors say they can’t — or shouldn’t. Transcript

item.title: 70: Other People's Mail | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description When you read other people’s mail, you can’t help but try to fill in between the lines. You try to decipher the stories of the people who wrote the letters. We hear four stories of people who read other people’s mail, and what happens to them once they get caught up in these other lives. Transcript

item.title: 69: Dream House | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description How many of our parents move to some place — some dream house — with some vision of a new life in the new place, and move the family with them, hoping it works out for the kids. Three stories on this theme. Transcript

item.title: 68: Lincoln's Second Inaugural | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description A show for July 4th weekend. We begin with perhaps the most moving, poetic inaugural speech in American history, and look at its legacy today. In his second inaugural address, Lincoln wondered aloud why God saw fit to send the slaughter of the Civil War to the United States. His conclusion: that slavery was a kind of original sin for the United States, for both North and South, and all Americans had to do penance for it.

item.title: 67: Your Dream, My Nightmare | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Could it be more obvious? Stories in which someone’s dream is someone else’s nightmare. All of us get into these situations with strangers, with the people we love most, with our own parents, with our children. Transcript

item.title: 66: Tales from the Net | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Are people having experiences on the Internet they wouldn’t have anywhere else? Several weeks ago, This American Life invited listeners to help answer that question. Transcript

item.title: 65: Who's Canadian? | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Notes and stories about the Canadians among us. Are they in fact any different from red-blooded Americans? They claim they’re not. Skeptical Americans put their position to the test. Transcript

item.title: 64: Summer | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories for the start of summer. We want summer to be this wonderful break, but so often it fails to deliver. We hear Ron Carlson’s short story about a summer job delivering tanks of oxygen to the infirm, Scott Carrier takes a river vacation, and more. Transcript

item.title: 63: One Thing | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description People whose lives are organized around one thing. Transcript

item.title: 62: Something for Nothing | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories of people trying to get rich quick or otherwise make something for nothing. As everyone knows, there’s no such thing as something for nothing. You always pay a price. Transcript

item.title: 61: Fiasco! (1997) | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories of when things go wrong. Really wrong. When you leave the normal realm of human error, fumble, mishap, and mistake and enter the territory of really huge breakdowns. Fiascos. Things go so awry that normal social order collapses. This week’s show is a philosophical inquiry in the nature of fiascos — perhaps the first ever. Transcript

item.title: 60: Business of Death | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Usually we talk about death as a tragedy, a mystery, a hard-to-comprehend fact of life. But in addition to all that, for all sorts of people it’s also … a job. This week, stories of undertakers, homicide detectives, slaughterhouse workers, enunculators, autopsy pathologists, exterminators, and others. Does their contact with death teach them something we should learn? Transcript

item.title: 59: Fire | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories about people who are not afraid of fire, though perhaps they should be. Transcript

item.title: 58: Small Towns | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories of small town life: the claustrophobia and freedom people feel in small towns, the yearning people feel in small towns. And three teenagers in one of the harshest urban environments explain how the public housing projects are like a small town. Transcript

item.title: 57: Delivery | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories about the delivery business and the people in it. UPS men, bike messengers, FedEx dispatchers. Transcript

item.title: 56: Name Change | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories of people changing their name — some to create a new identity, some to con people. Name changes are particularly American stories: they’re the dream of starting over with a clean slate. They’re Ellis Island and 12-step programs, the move westward and self help, Marilyn Monroe and Malcolm X and the Artist Formerly Known as Prince, all rolled up in one. Transcript

item.title: 55: Three Women and the Sex Industry | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description A few months ago, radio producer Sandy Tolan was supposed to do a documentary about strippers with an aspiring writer — and stripper — named Susan. A few days before they were to begin working together, Susan disappeared, presumed dead. Transcript

item.title: 54: Sinatra | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories, tributes, and attempts to understand the Chairman of the Board. Transcript

item.title: 53: Valentine’s Day ‘97 | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description For Valentine’s Day, stories about our parents falling in love. And troubles with their love. From Hilton Als, Scott Carrier, Julie Showalter, a magazine column called Men My Mother Dated and others. The idea for this show was inspired by Delmore Schwartz’s classic 1937 work of American fiction about his parents’ courtship: In Dreams Begin Responsibilities and Other Stories. Transcript

item.title: 52: Edge of Sanity | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories about the border between mental health and mental illness. Transcript

item.title: 51: Animals Die, People Ponder | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories of people who handle dead animals. Don’t worry — it’s not as gross as it sounds. In fact, not disgusting at all. A story by George Saunders about an animal control man who falls in unrequited love. A woman who studies illuminated manuscripts, whose pages look like paper but are in fact animals. And other stories. Transcript

item.title: 50: Shoulda Been Dead | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Kevin Kelly was in Jerusalem. For reasons too complicated to go into here, he ended up sleeping on the spot where Jesus was supposedly crucified. After Kevin awoke, he got rid of all his possessions. He visited his parents and brothers and sisters for the last time. That, and other stories of starting life over, including a visit to a courtroom in Los Angeles where people go to change their names.

item.title: 49: Animals | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories about the animalness of animals, the irreducible ways in which they are not human. Transcript

item.title: 48: Justice | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Kitty Felde shows a side of the Yugoslav War Crimes Trials that hasn’t been discussed anywhere: a portrait of Americans at the International Tribunal. And other stories. Transcript

item.title: 47: Christmas and Commerce | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories about the intersection of Christmas and retail, originally broadcast in 1996 when our show was only a year old. Including David Sedaris’s story “Santaland Diaries,” which first aired on NPR’s Morning Edition in a much shorter version. Transcript

item.title: 46: Sissies | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Though being gay no longer has much of a stigma in some parts of the country, being a sissy still does — even among gay men. In this show we have a number of surprising and unusual stories of sissies, their families, and why people still get so upset about them. Transcript

item.title: 45: Media Fringe | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Four stories about people struggling at the fringes of our nation’s media/music/infotainment industry. Transcript

item.title: 44: Poultry Slam 1996 | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description In the midst of the five biggest poultry-consumption weeks of the year—the five weeks between Thanksgiving and Christmas, when Americans consume one-fourth of all the turkey they eat in a year—This American Life presents stories about turkeys, chickens, ducks, and fowl of all kinds. Transcript

item.title: 43: Faustian Bargains | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Inspired by a spate of new Chicago stage adaptations of the Faust story, This American Life brings you stories of people who made a deal with the devil. Transcript

item.title: 42: Get Over It! | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Three stories of people trying to forget the past and move on. Transcript

item.title: 41: Politics | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description More stories of the election you can’t hear anywhere else. Transcript

item.title: 40: Lessons | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories from acclaimed storyteller Spalding Gray and others. Transcript

item.title: 39: Halloween | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description This week: A show for Halloween. Stories of things that are supposed to be scary, but aren’t. Transcript

item.title: 38: Simulated Worlds | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Simulated worlds, Civil War reenactments, wax museums, simulated coal mines, fake ethnic restaurants, an ersatz Medieval castle and other re-created worlds that thrive all across America. Transcript

item.title: 37: The Job That Takes Over Your Life | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Radio producer Scott Carrier quit his job at a low moment in his life. His wife left him and took the kids. And he got a job interviewing schizophrenics for some medical researchers. After doing it a while, he began to wonder if he was a schizophrenic himself. And more stories. Transcript

item.title: 36: Letters | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Host Ira Glass and playwright David Hauptschein took out advertisements in Chicago inviting people to come to a small theater with letters they’ve received, sent, or found. Transcript

item.title: 35: Fall Clearance Sale | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Evocative, funny, emotional stories collected over the last few months that haven’t fit into any of our regular “theme” shows. Transcript

item.title: 34: Democratic Convention | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Unusual stories from the 1996 Democratic Convention in Chicago, with scenes and moments not documented elsewhere. Transcript

item.title: 33: A Night at the Wiener Circle | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Host Ira Glass spent a Saturday night — from 9:00 p.m. until dawn the next morning — at one of the most frenetic, joyous, efficient, angry, boisterous hot dog stands in the nation: Chicago’s own Wiener Circle. Transcript

item.title: 32: Republican Convention | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Unusual stories about day-to-day life at the Republican Convention. Transcript

item.title: 31: When You Talk About Music | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories of people whose lives are transformed by music. Transcript

item.title: 30: Obsession | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories of obsession and compulsion. What happens when a little idea starts to control you. Co-hosted by Paul Tough. Transcript

item.title: 29: Bob Dole | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Unusual perspectives on the presumptive Republican nominee. Transcript

item.title: 28: Detectives | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Writer David Sedaris recalls the days when his mother and sister played armchair detective — until a very odd crime wave hit within their own home. Plus, host Ira Glass goes out on surveillance with a real-life private eye. Transcript

item.title: 27: The Cruelty of Children | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories about kids being mean to each other, including a mysterious handbook for bullies, a surprising experiment conducted by a teacher who wants to make kids be nice, and a story of youthful backstabbing told by David Sedaris. Transcript

item.title: 26: Father's Day '96 | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Ira’s own father, Barry Glass, co-hosts this special Father’s Day show. Transcript

item.title: 25: Basketball | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description A set of documentary stories, radio essays and monologues about basketball, the Chicago Bulls, and their grip on Chicagoans’ hearts and lives during the NBA playoffs. Transcript

item.title: 24: Teenaged Girls | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories of girls who have to figure out how they’re going to act when the ground rules are constantly shifting. Transcript

item.title: 23: Drama Bug | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories of the people who fall for a life in the theater. Transcript

item.title: 22: Adult Children | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories of the difficult relationships between parents and their grown children, including two long stories from Sandra Tsing Loh about her father. Transcript

item.title: 21: Factions | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description A show about something most people have gone through. Friends get together to start a business, start a church, do political action together. And after a while, they start fighting and split up. We hear three true stories. Transcript

item.title: 20: From A Distance | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories of hero worship, of people admiring someone from afar, and trying to get closer to them. Transcript

item.title: 19: Rich Guys | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Men who had comfortable, decent lives, yet decided to do something wild and eccentric with their lives instead. Transcript

item.title: 18: Liars | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description April first is the one day of the year when we’re allowed to enjoy deceiving others. But April Fools’ Day is for amateur deceivers. The real pros are the people who can’t control their lying, who lie without even knowing what the truth is. Everyone’s known someone like this, but it’s a topic that’s only rarely studied or discussed publicly. Journalist and former This American Life contributing editor Margy Rochlin co-hosts.

item.title: 17: Name Change / No Theme | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Our first show as This American Life. Transcript

item.title: 16: Economy | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories of politics, the economy, and the big picture. Transcript

item.title: 15: Dawn | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Writer Jack Hitt goes on a search for a mysterious neighbor from his childhood in Charleston, South Carolina, and stumbles onto an epic story of the Old South, the New South, gender confusion, Chihuahuas, and changing values in American journalism. Transcript

item.title: 14: Accidental Documentaries | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description What unites these stories on the surface is that they’re all made from old tapes, recordings found in attics and thrift stores. What unites them under that surface — and not far under it — is that they all end up being stories about fathers and the legacies that fathers leave their children. Transcript

item.title: 13: Love | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Explorations of the dream of true love and the difficulties with achieving and maintaining that dream. Transcript

item.title: 12: Animals | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories about the animalness of animals, the irreducible ways in which they are not human. Transcript

item.title: 11: Enemies | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description A story of a friendship between two adolescent boys that was destroyed through the manipulative acts of one of them. Transcript

item.title: 10: Double Lives | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description People living their lives, just like the rest of us. Plus an extra life. Transcript

item.title: 9: Julia Sweeney | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description When comedian Julia Sweeney and her brother both got cancer, she decided to tell the story the best way she knew how: in a comedy club. It might seem like a strange choice, but what resulted is halfway between standup comedy and true-life diary entries. Transcript

item.title: 8: New Year | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories that reflect back on 1995. Transcript

item.title: 7: Quitting | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories of people who quit everything in their lives that they hated—and what happened to them afterwards. Transcript

item.title: 6: Christmas | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Transcript

item.title: 5: Anger and Forgiveness | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories that reveal the societal “trend” toward anger and away from genuine forgiveness. Transcript

item.title: 4: Vacations | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories about vacations gone awry—or perhaps vacations that never should have happened. Transcript

item.title: 3: Poultry Slam 1995 | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Stories decrying the wonders of turkeys, chickens, and other fowl. Transcript

item.title: 2: Small Scale Sin | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Small-scale stories on the nature of small-scale sin. Transcript

item.title: 1: New Beginnings | This American Life
item.description: Podcast Description Our program’s very first broadcast. Transcript
